title: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer feels players aren't listening as some Utd stars lose faith in manager
text:
Solskjaer is feeling the heat at United (Picture: Getty)

A section of Manchester United’s squad have lost faith in Ole Gunnar Solskjaer and the Norwegian reportedly feels his players have stopped listening to him.

Solskjaer is facing the toughest spell of his United career to date after another Premier League defeat left his side just two points above the relegation zone.

United welcome Liverpool to Old Trafford after the international break and there are concerns a heavy defeat could see the end of Solskjaer’s reign.

The Sun claim Solskjaer has been trying and failing to kick his players into gear, but is concerned some of his senior players have switched off completely after a dismal start to the campaign.

Solskjaer is trying to deploy Sir Alex Ferguson’s ‘hairdryer’ tactic, but a number of players are confused as to what their head coach’s grand plan is.

Rivals have quickly snuffed out Solskjaer’s counter-attacking formations, but the United boss has accused his players of abandoning his game plans during matches.

Solskjaer has even suggested there a host of Championship sides are better than his side and watched in horror as Newcastle’s Longstaff brothers dominated the midfield on Sunday.

Matty Longstaff, just 19, would go on to score the winner for Newcastle on his debut for the club.

Some of United’s senior players have lost faith in their manager (Picture: Rex Features)

Solskjaer has defended his players in public, but has repeatedly lambasted his players behind closed doors in recent weeks, branding them ’embarrassing’.

Despite Ed Woodward’s recent public backing, Solskjaer told his players after the loss to Newcastle that they were going to get him sacked if they continued to under-perform.
